topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1: Network Administrator Notes

body.p: The HPE Helion OpenStack(R) cloud networking platform is based on the OpenStack(R) standard. OpenStack(R) defines an architecture and compliant vendors (of which HPE is one) create the implementations. HPE Helion is one of these OpenStack(R) implementations.
The OpenStack(R) Cloud Administrator Notes describe the common administrator tasks required to enable and maintain the primary OpenStack(R) services. These primary services are shown below.

As a Helion administrator, you should follow the OpenStack(R) Cloud Administrator Guide (available at http://docs.openstack.org/) to enable and maintain each of these OpenStack(R) services. Then refer to this guide for additional information to enable and maintain Helion OpenStack(R) This guide will explain what you have to do in addition to, or instead of, what is in the OpenStack(R) guide.

To simplify the interaction between the OpenStack(R) Cloud Administrator Guide and this guide, this Helion administrator guide mirrors the organization of the OpenStack(R) Cloud Administrator Guide . To manage Neutron for example, refer to the OpenStack(R) guide on Neutron (Chapter 7, Networking), then refer to Managing the Network service in this guide to determine if Helion OpenStack(R) requires configuration steps.
Because OpenStack(R) defines a platform with multiple services, administrators need to understand how these services interact and interdepend. The following illustration explains these relationships.
The OpenStack(R) Cloud Administrator Guide is available on the OpenStack(R) website http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/content/index.html
To help you perform your administrative roles in these areas, this guide includes information on:

section.title: Managing the Identity service (#Managing-the-Identity-service)
section.p: OpenStack(R) Identity, code-named keystone, is the default identity management system for OpenStack(R) Configuring the OpenStack(R) Identity service is sufficient for Helion administrators. No additional work is required to support HPE Helion OpenStack(R)

section.title: Managing the Dashboard (Managing-the-Dashboard)
section.p: The OpenStack(R) dashboard, code named Horizon, is a Web-based interface that allows you to manage OpenStack(R) resources and services. The dashboard allows you to interact with the OpenStack(R) Compute cloud controller using the OpenStack(R) APIs. In the Helion environment, HPE uses HPE Badge and the Helion undercloud dashboard in addition to Horizon.

section.title: Managing the Compute service (Managing-the-Compute-service)
section.p: The OpenStack(R) Compute service (code named Nova) allows you to control an Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) cloud computing platform. It gives you control over instances and networks, and allows you to manage access to the cloud through users and projects. Configuring the OpenStack(R) Compute service is sufficient for Helion administrators. No additional work is required.

section.title: Managing Object Storage (Managing-Object-Storage
section.p: OpenStack(R) Object Storage (code-named swift) is open source software for creating redundant, scalable data storage using clusters of standardized storage servers. Configuring the OpenStack(R) Object Storage service is sufficient for Helion administrators. No additional work is required.

section.title: Managing the Network service (Managing-the-Network-service)
section.p: The Networking service, code-named Neutron, provides an API that lets you define network connectivity and addressing in the cloud. Configuring the OpenStack(R) Network service is largely sufficient for Helion administrators.
For details on configuring Helion Neutron, see Neutron Prerequisites.

section.title: Managing Metering (Managing-the-Database)
section.p: Metering (code named Ceilometer) supports billing systems for OpenStack(R) cloud resources. As the list of meters expands, metering data can be analyzed for different purposes other than billing. Configuring the OpenStack(R) Metering service is sufficient for Helion administrators. No additional work is required.
